edu.mit.lib.bagit

Class Bag

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mit.lib.bagit.Bag

  • public class Bag
extends java.lang.Object
    Bag represents a rudimentary bag conformant to LC Bagit spec - version 0.97. A Bag is a directory with contents and a little structured metadata in it. Although they don't have to be, these bags are 'wormy' - meaning that they can be written only once (have no update semantics), and can be 'holey' - meaning they can contain content by reference as well as inclusion. Bags are not directly instantiated - package helper classes (Filler, Loader) can create bags and serialize them to a compressed archive file (supported formats zip or tgz) or be deserialized from same or a stream, abiding by the serialization recommendations of the specification. See README for sample invocations and API description.
